Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ymaldonado
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only one night on St. Patrick´s Day. All the B&B and hotels in Key West were booked and this was the only one where we found two rooms for only one night at a reasonable price. Rooms are clean but with a little moldy smell in the bathroom. The breakfast is ok but not spectacular. Too far from the city center but conveniently close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel 4 miles from duval street”
Reviews.Author: reviewer4657
Reviews.Content: Large rooms and very clean. Pool area was nice although didn't seem like it was heated the day we swam. Quick cab ride to duval street - be aware that its a flat rate of $4.50 per person from the area (key west is divided into "zones"). Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: jenhec
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here. The pool area is beautiful, the screened porches are a very nice touch, and I thought the breakfast was excellent. The location is about 10-15 minute drive from the fun part of key west, so if you drive you'll have to pay to park downtown. But the big water just across the busy street from the motel is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, friendly employees.”
Reviews.Author: SFOF/A
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we wanted to visit Key West and not stay right in the downtown area. We wanted a place with a pool, a place to do your laundry, breakfast included and a snack bar. Best Western Key Ambassador fit the bill exactly. We were between cruises out of Miami, and decided to book a few days in Key West. I'm happy we read the reviews and chose this hotel. It isn't too far from downtown, however, you'll need to take the shuttle, a bus, or drive, its too far to walk. Our room was very clean and large with two queen beds and a large flat screen tv. We even had a small screened in balcony we sat on occasionally. No view, except for trees covering the next door apt building. The laundry was near the office, I forget the cost, not expensive. You can also buy detergent at the front desk. The pool is large and free form. Perfect for an evening swim after a hot day walking around Key West. At the pool area, is the Cheekie Hut, where you can get cocktails and food. It closes early, no dinner, just lunch and snacks. There are TV's at the bar to watch sports if you like, or you can sit by the pool, drink in hand and enjoy a swim. The people who work here are very friendly and drinks are very good. I did two loads of laundry and spent my waiting time at Cheekies. Breakfast was continental, including hard boiled eggs, fruit, all kinds of toast, jams, butter, cereal, yogurt, coffee, tea and juices. Perfect! It's served in a nice little breakfast area, which was in the building where we were staying. A simple walk down the stairs and there we were! We drove into town during the day and had no trouble finding street parking. Be sure to pay in the machines! We walked all over and saw beautiful homes, shops, bars, restaurants, museums, and of course had lunch with Conch fritters as a starter and Key Lime pie for dessert. We were happy to return to the Best Western Key for a swim, drink and relaxation each day. The planes didn't bother us, and no planes at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice escape in Key West”
Reviews.Author: TriRidge
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed relaxing here after days in the busier parts of Key West. Room was large, well-appointed, and clean. There was a screened balcony overlooking the pool with a view of the ocean. Pool area was large and good for lounging. Ocean and a sidewalk were across the street. Breakfasts were more than adequate. A couple of restaurants were within walking distance. Airplane noise didn't bother us that much; and didn't hear planes at night. Pricey, but less so than many lesser places in Key West. (No elevators if that's important to you.)

Reviews.Title: “We were Lucky”
Reviews.Author: James Y
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Key West with no reservations to find a run taking place. We arrived at the Best Western and the only room they had left was the apartment the owner uses when they are in town. What a find 2 bedrooms, kitchen living room and a full size balcony overlooking the ocean. The hotel was clean and the pool was great. The only area that needs looking at is where you take breakfast which is very small for the number of rooms. The choice of items was OK . A bit procey but that was our fault for not booking ahead. Would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Ocean views!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while back with my family and revisited with my partner quite a few years later to find is was still as I remembered. The room was clean and the views were to die for! No noise from other rooms that we noticed, big bed and large dressing area. The tikki bar had amazing frozen margaritas and the pool was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: JudyChicagoland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful but our room smelled like mildew. The pool area was beautiful and right across from the beach too. The front desk people could have been a little more friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Key West”
Reviews.Author: W_Grainger
Reviews.Content: The is the second time (both times in January) we have stayed at this hotel and the quality and value are the best in Key West. The hotel is not close to the main attractions of Key West, but it is just a short car ride away. The Trolly Tours stops at the hotel several times a day and it is a great way to take in all the attractions.. The hotel is near the airport but we only noticed the planes during the day, at night it is very quiet. Our ground floor room was quite large, we had a very comfortable king size bed, a sofa in front of a large window looking out on some palm trees and well kept grounds. The room had a fridge, microwave oven and wi-fi, the bathroom was large and very clean. They serve a great continental breakfast, although it was in the far end of the resort so it was a bit of a walk from our room. The gem of this hotel is the pool area, which is large, beautifully landscaped, and surrounded by palm trees. As we drove to Key West from Canada, we picked up a roomsaver coupon book at a Florida rest stop and there was a coupon for this hotel which made the Best Western Key Ambassador Resort Inn a great deal for the price..

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: thegasgod_slcut
Reviews.Content: Down in the keys for one night. Chose this hotel based on price and it's a bit removed from the hustle and bustle. One exception, it's right next to the airport! No planes throughout night but they start at about 8:00 am and run through about 10:00. Beds were nice and comfy, nice linens as well. Overall a nice place to stay. Staff was great. Breakfast was nice with several options.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bill L
Reviews.Content: We chose this motel because of it's price and that it is on the ocean. Upon checking in we were given an additional discount which mad the price even better. Our room was very spacious with a King bed, couch, table and even something like a 40" flat screen TV. The room was clean, the staff was very helpfull, and the grounds were well maintained. Unfortunaley we never had time to check out the pool area, although it also loked very nice. Guess we now have a reason to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tkdiver1
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the reasonable rates for a quick trip to Key West. It is next to the airport, however, we were not bothered in the night by air traffic noise. The room was clean, nice size, and enjoyable view out large picture window. The grounds were nicely kept. We enjoyed walking the waterfront walkway in front of the hotel and the shuffleboard game. The hotel is located in a less populated area of the island, yet just a short drive to the tourist attractions. We were not impressed with the breakfast, but would not hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay..”
Reviews.Author: prisky
Reviews.Content: Upon driving in to the hotel complex I questioned my decision to stay here. From the outside the place doesn't look that impressive, very 50's motel. I check in for 3 nights and receive a room on the lower ground. My room was supposed to have habour views. Well it did have water views but I had to stand very close to the window whilst standing up. I wouldn't call this habour view. Anyway, I didn't bother to complain as we didn't plan on spending too much time in our room. The room itself was huge. With a very comfortable King size bed, couch, table with two chairs, TV, Microwave and fridge. The walls were a bit thin, during one night our neighbours were very noisy we could hear everything. The pool area was nice and I spent many hours there. The water is also heated in winter. There is a bar selling snacks and drinks. Yes, there are planes going past but it didn't bother us. I actually enjoyed watching the various planes taking off. Outside the hotel there is a nice walk along the ocean. It was great for early morning walks and to watch the sunset. Downtown Key west, including Duval street is not very far by car. It took us 5-10 minutes to drive and parking was not an issue. There is also a beach within 2-3 minutes drive. Breakfast was standard continental breakfast with fruit, pastries, bread, waffle, yoghurt, tea, coffee, juice. The only bad thing about breakfast time was the size of the room, there were a small number of tables. If you turn up for breakfast at 9am expect to wait for a table. Overall our stay was pleasant. Key West is an expensive place, especially in January, this place was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a great hideout”
Reviews.Author: Servico
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days here in early Dec. 2011. The room was huge,with a screened porch. The view from the porch was not any thing to write home about but it was comfortable. Breakfast was in my building a few steps away. It was ample for my wife and me. We did not use the pool but it was there and available. Being an plane buff this was also a plus as the KW airport was behind us and NAS KW also beside. I could watch all the activity. One of the best kept secrets of KW is the beach, a stones throw away. KW is 2x4 so even though you are at the eastern end it is still only 15 miniutes from Mallory Square. Want more breakfast choice Dennys and IHOP are just over on North Roosevelt. Mike & Madeleine Casselman ON

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value; fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: Decided to go to Key West for New Years following house hunting trip further up the coast. Picked this hotel as it seemed the best value, especially in the height of the season and as Best Westerns usually always offer good value for the money. Didn't know what to expect as I had read some of the previous reviews here. We were very pleasantly surprised; I had requested an ocean view room, when we checked in we were offered choice of first or second floor. We chose second floor (be aware there is no elevator, but the steps are not bad); when we walked into our room we were stunned by the view! Room was large, clean and just delightful; sitting on the balcony having coffee and watching the sunrise was wonderful. The staff was very, very friendly and helpful; everyone from the front desk to the bar attendents at the "Cheekie Hut" by the pool. Pool area teriffic (yes, there are the white ibis walking around, but that adds to the fun). Downsides are the airport right next door, but as previously mentioned, not an issue at night. Also, the ocean view rooms do face S. Roosevelt Blvd, so you do have some traffic noise. We took either cab or bus into town; a little inconvenient but it was New Years weekend. Short drive/medium walk to nice beach area. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Bad and good”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Bad points: * Right next to the airport - loud aircraft overhead all day. * Found cockroaches in my room (pest control called in). * Air conditioning too loud to use at night (& still sleep). * No food facilities apart from basic breakfast. * Rooms from outside look like a 1950's holiday camp complex Good points: * Helpful staff * Pool was fabulous * Location was next to the ocean * Room decor was good * Gave me one day's refund when I showed them the cockroaches on cameraphone. Summary: Has 2.5 star rating on tripadvisor which is probably correct.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Kay M
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. Very clean and everyone is very friendly. Great screened in balconys lets you enjoy your coffee outside but somewhat out of sight. Very quiet. There is an international airport very near but it wasn't a problem as the planes don't fly in and out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Out of town”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer35
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, Situated approx 3 miles from town centre but no eating places within a mile of the hotel.Very friendly and helpful reception. A large and pleasantly decorated room, although not containing a safe. As the complex is spread out there can be a walk of up to 200m to the breakfast area which could be a problem for people with disabilities, or if the weather was inclement. Very good choice for breakfast. Could be noisy at times as very close to the civil airport plus jets & transport planes from the nearby Naval Air Station.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: WinnieFareham
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this Hotel 3 times over recent years and each time have been made extremely welcome. The Hotel is a little way out of Key West Old Town but this adds to the feeling of peace and space (the airport is quite nearby so if you don't want flight noise this isn't right for you.) We didn't find the noise of a few planes intrusive but quite interesting. The rooms are large and the beds very comfortable, we had a balcony (with bugscreen) overlooking the pool area and the sea beyond and the early morning sun was a bonus! The pool area is very pleasant, the water very warm, and the pool towels little short of luxurious. White ibis share the pool surround(no doubt having been encouraged by guests at one time) but this adds to the charm.There is a very good breakfast included in the room price. Staff at the Front Desk are very friendly and a mine of information. We used the Old Town Trolley to go into Key West Old Town but the buses are very cheap also if you don't want to drive. We look forward to staying here again next time we visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS & RABID RACOON'S AVAILABLE HERE !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: We came to Key West to watch the boat races and instead we became food for the bed bugs at the hotel. And if this wasn't enough we were treated to a show of rabid racoons' begging for food at the breakfast room in the bright daylight sun. When we tried to point this out to the front desk we were told they were no-seeum bites.

Reviews.Title: “Started out as an A plus but went to an F”
Reviews.Author: BFLYNN013
Reviews.Content: Start of checking in we were allowed to check the room we wanted to stay in. We choose king size bed window view of harbor. If you want a balcony room it will cost more. There is no beach, it is about mile down, but they have a nice pool with bar. If you want to be away from Duval Street this is the place to stay. We had a car, so it was ok. We encountered a problem with a Gieco, lizard in our room. I went and explained that I wanted that thing gone. Maintenance was sent but could not find it. I wanted another room and that is when I was rudely treated by the evening front desk clerk. She was out of line, telling me she would not move us again. I would have to cope with it. I am not from here, and we don't have those little creatures in our houses, I don't want one sleeping with me. Beware of the creatures and the evening clerk.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Best Western Ambassador”
Reviews.Author: nyikesa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well taken care of. The beds were totally awesome, very comfortable. The rooms were clean, had fridge and microwave. Very convenient. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was definitely an asset. It was a jaunt to Duval, but we rented bikes for the 4 days and got plenty of exercising riding to and from the hotel to the downtown area. The pool area is well taken care of and very pretty. The cost of drinks at the tiki bar were quite expensive. A round of 4 drinks cost us $56......they need to have more reasonably priced drinks. The staff was wonderful, helpful and very responsive. Would definitely stay there again. Well taken care of grounds. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool & near beach”
Reviews.Author: ginapic21
Reviews.Content: So I was a little disappointed when i pulled up to the hotel because it was motel style with the doors to the room outside. However, the room was spacoius, clean and the bed was comfortable. The pool is really nice and has a tiki bar. You can't bring in your own drinks just so you know. Hotel is located within walking distance to a beach. It's about a 5-10min drive to the main Key West area on Duval St. You can rent bicycles and have them delivered to the hotel for about $15/day and ride there which may take you about 15 mins- seems like the easiest way to get around. We had a car and didn't have any issues finding parking on side streets around Duval St. The hotel is right near the airport so the first morning I was awakened by an airplane but I had read about that. It's not a very busy airport so it's not like they are flying over your hotel every 2 mins. Continetal breakfast was decent. Lots of carbs but some frresh fruit too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: RavenHater
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean, and the propeerty was very nice. The hotel being on a trolley stop was an added bonus. While the breakfast was nice, there was nowhere near enough seating. What was there was very cramped. More care should be taken to keep foreign tourists from trying to feed/pet the raccoons that live on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant surprise”
Reviews.Author: kimd13
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the day after a long journey and were not expecting a huge amount when we booked in. But the receptionist was very welcoming and friendly and when we opened the door to our room we had a fantastic surprise, the room was spacious, absolutley spotless and had a great view of the ocean. A huge kingsize bed a couch and dressing table lovely soft towels what more could you ask for. The only minor downside was the breakfast room, it was a little too small for the size of the hotel and it was a bit of a squeeze to get to a table and quite hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “A ray of sunshine during a very rainy vacation”
Reviews.Author: skeese
Reviews.Content: We drove over 900 miles to arrive to a soggy Key West. Our room was very spacious and we had a beautiful view of the ocean. The hotel surprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room for my 50th birthday. This was such a nice touch since we were a little down about the weather. The beds were quite comfy. We ended up changing our length of stay and it was not a problem at all with the hotel. The hotel breakfast could use a few more healthier choices. It is basically waffles and pastries. The trolley picks up at the hotel and we used this service for two days and it was great. We did not have to worry with parking which can be a problem in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “All around GREAT hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GiftedWhenLifted
Reviews.Content: Right when we get there we see they have two free computers to use. Not the newest but enough to change your fantasy lineup. We then find out we've been upgrade to an ocean view and queen beds. Get to the rooms and they are very spacious with everything necessary. Pool is wonderful overlooking the ocean. Bar open that serves food and drinks. Breakfast is more than enough. All staff are more than willing to help you out. Great location on the ocean and close to a beach. But a little bit of a drive to Duval and all of the Key Lime goodies.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: t-c67
Reviews.Content: we loved this place, the room was very clean and smelled wonderful, there were lots of towels and the bed was comfortable. There were laundry facilities for guests and the breakfast was great, it was served in its own room which is great as often there are in a hotel reception which can be a bit cramped but there was plenty of room and loads to chose from, including waffles! The pool was wonderful and in beautiful surroundings with a tiki bar, i highly recommend the margaritas! The check in staff were absolutely lovely and it was quick and easy. If we ever are lucky enough to go back to Key West I can't think of anywhere I'd rather stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Quite”
Reviews.Author: tpleck
Reviews.Content: When trying to decide where to stay for this trip, I was rather suprised how hard it was to find a place that was affordable, clean and had a oceanview. Well, this hotel met all those requirements. Our room was an second story oceanview. We could lay in bed and open the curtains and see the ocean, birds, boats go by. Of course you can tell that it is an older facility as soon as you take a glance at the bathroom area, but it was clean. I do remember having some trouble adjusting the shower to get the temp just right and it all worked out in the end. I loved the pool area and enjoyed my time laying and soaking up the sun watching others on vacation playing in the pool just having family time. The only short coming was the bar. Well, really it depended on who was working the bar. The first day the gentleman there could care less if you had to wait for service or not. Now I am not talking about a high volume bar. He got to you when he was good and ready. The next few days was an inprovement. There was a lady there and she did a much better job. The grounds are very well kept and the office staff was helpful. We needed to extend our stay there by one day as someone in our group became ill and they were able to grant our request. You are not very close to the action, but really the island is small enough that it really is not an issue. If you use the trolley you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: JDfromTexas
Reviews.Content: We went to visit our son who is stationed in the Coast Guard at Key West. This hotel was perfect for us. It was clean and even had a screened in porch in the back. Refrigerator,Microwave and LCD screen TV with movie channels. Quiet sleeping conditions. The breakfast was right down the way from our room, featuring french toast,waffles,muffins and my favorite "coffee". The pool was very nice and relaxing with a pool bar. I paid $10 for a decent sized strawberry margaritta which wasn't bad. All in all a place I would recommend. Located right across from the ocean, so you can go for a stroll along the boardwalk and see the jelly fish. I would return to this hotel next time I visit. They even have a trolley stop in front of the hotel. Relax and enjoy Key West....

Reviews.Title: “No other place in the WORLD we would rather stay at.”
Reviews.Author: PatCat77
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 5 times over 5 years, my wife and I are involved in the entertainment business so we stay at a lot of places..this is our FAVORITE, we look forward to our stay all year long. The staff has made us feel like family, they go far beyond what is required to make our stay the very best possible. Clean, beautiful relaxing surroundings, the best pool and cheekie hut on the keys...away from the hassle of downtown but yet very accessible to all Key West has to offer. Everyday the staff helped us to find a new and interesting place to see or eat at. We will be there again in June. We love everyone there and think you will have the same experience. Pat and Cathy Coyne

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Earth”
Reviews.Author: buzfuller
Reviews.Content: Best pool in Key West. Beautiful landscapeing. Friendly staff. Loved the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: missyross27
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8/8-8/11, received a great rate, and enjoyed our stay. The room was nice overlooking the pool which we loved. Also, the continental breakfast was great and there was plenty of food. The view is wonderful as the ocean is right across the street and Smather's beach is within walking distance. The hotel clerk on the days we stayed, I think his name was Joey went out of his way to help us. He was very friendly and always helpful. The planes were not a problem as there were only a couple a day and I did not really notice them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Morgan K
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, stayed for 5 nights and was very impressed with how responsive the staff was. Very help, great pool, bar and good breakfast. Would absolutely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: TMLT
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at this hotel and were satisfied with our stay. This was definitely a value hotel, which we knew going in, so our expectations were not too high. The hotel looks rather unappealing on the outside, but the room was nice. It was very spacious and clean; we were quite comfortable. The amenities aren't stellar, but were good given the cost. The continental breakfast was better than expected, the pool area was fine, and the staff was helpful and friendly. As other reviews indicate, this place is RIGHT next to the airport. We did experience the thunderous rattlings of a few landing planes, but it was not so frequent that we regretted staying here. During our stay there was only one early morning (8 am) landing, but most seemed to occur during the day when we were out and about. We had a rental car, but we definitely recommend renting bikes to check out the island. We did this one day and thoroughly enjoyed it. The front desk will make the arrangements and the bikes will be delivered to the hotel. Overall, if you're looking for a good value rather than a lot of bells and whistles, and you don't mind a few planes, this place fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the center of things, but fine with me!”
Reviews.Author: GyrlGeek
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to be right in the center of town, then choose a different hotel. If you want to get more of a feel for the rest of Key West, choose this hotel. We arrived late at night and you can literally walk from the tiny Key West Airport. (The sound of the airport was never a problem for us.) This place has the MOST comfortable bed I've ever slept in and we had an excellent view. The grounds are outstanding...the mangroves are not to be missed. Free breakfast, helpful staff and by far the most affordable spot on Key West makes this a great place to stay. I recommend renting a car because it's not walkable in the tropical heat, the cabs can get pricey and there isn't a late night public transportation system on the island. I would stay here again if I got a good deal, but I think next time I might want to be closer to the action. Overall it was a nice, clean affordable motel style hotel. I'm giving it an extra star for the great view and extra comfy bed. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: AllenWeiss
Reviews.Content: The front desk people were very friendly, helpful, and efficient. Special thanks to Taylor, Joseph and Jay. The room was one of the nicest motel rooms I have stayed in. The was more than enough light; the room was large and friendly, and the shower was great. I rarely send comments about accommodations, but this motel stay was great. Allen Weiss

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches, and very crabby staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bradleyjhardy
Reviews.Content: Do not even consider staying here. We thought we got a great deal when we payed under $500 for 5 days on Bookit.com. But we found out that you really get what you pay for. Cockroaches and tiny ants everywhere. Located in the most undesirable area of Key West, at the end of a runway. No view, and not close to any beach whatsoever. The main desk staff were ok to deal with, overall not friendly, like you were being a pain when you asked a question But the tiki bar woman was having a stretch of bad days and taking out on the guests. She told us we could not have flotation device for our child in the pool. Later that day she was talking it up with her friend who brought severel children with innertubes. I complained to front desk and was told she was just that way. The breakfast was ok, except for the creepy guy who was supervising the area. Again. Do Not Stay Here! There are much better places closer to beaches with friendy staff.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it so much awsome place to stay with the family!!!”
Reviews.Author: gigidolce8
Reviews.Content: it was the best service ever i had a great room over looking the ocean it was so calmimg. my family was so happy the hotel was very clean.rooms were very nice and also the pool was nice temp on such a hot summer day i advice any one that goes to the keys to stay min away from every thing and its just such a great hotel breakfest right from are room every morning it was the best loved it so much i well be back soon... :)

Reviews.Title: “This was a Fine Motel”
Reviews.Author: schatsi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while visiting Key West. The room was clean and the location was very nice - right across the street from the water. It was a short 10 minute drive to the main shopping street. By the way, it was no problem to get free parking about 4 blocks or so from Duval Street. No need to pay the exorbitant parking fees of the parking lots. The breakfast was good with all the usual food items. Overall, we were happy with our stay and would stay at the Key Ambassador Resort Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer752
Reviews.Content: Booked my stay on hotels.com for three days & 4th night free. The so-called harbor view was through the window which was blokes by the trees & no balcony. We were put in a building which was away from the main compound, felt like we were put in a cheap motel. The worst part is that there is an ant infestation, they gave us a can of spray but my daughter has allergies, so there were ants everywhere. The air conditioner was on it's last leg so it was extremely loud and kept us up all night for the next two days, when we inquired about moving, they quickly dismissed any thought of that as though they had rehearsed their speech. The a/c finally died the 3rd day, and it was replaced with a unit that was even worse. Even though we had one more night remaining at the motel, I had enough after 3 days of no sleep, packed my family up and skipped town. Did I mention that the motel is at the end of the runway?!...

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay and will return!!”
Reviews.Author: bamamail
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at Key Ambassador and loved it! It was close to airport but the noises were only during the day, we werent disturbed at all by planes. It is located on the quiet side of the island and we choose to rent scooters and drive to downtown area. This was great we were able to enjoy the fun side but go back and relax on quiet side. Pool area was very nice but we would have really enjoyed longer hours. The hotel was very responsive to anything we needed, and room was very clean and well laid out. We are looking forward to our next stay here.......love, love, love it !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location!! Very nice room!!! Will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: bodhi0916
Reviews.Content: Hotel sits right across from the beach - so beautiful!! Fantastic pool and pool tiki bar. The rooms are very nice - recently remodeled. Excellent included continental breakfast, as well. Is a little far from town, but the city bus comes to hotel and so does the Old Towne Trolley, although if you are late nighters like we are you will need to cab back as we did. Never a problem to get a cab!! The bathroom in the hotel rooms are small and not much but they are clean and the large size of thr room made up for it. VERY nice staff at the front desk!! Airport very close but never bothered by the noise at all,

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: meadowmaxine
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great staff! Beautiful pool. The poolside bartender was great. Front desk people couldn't be more helpful. Duvall St is only a short bus ride away the pick up right at the hotel. Loved the cookies in the afternoon.PLEASE NOTE THE AIRPLANES OVER HEAD ARE NOT BAD AT ALL AND THEY STOP FLYING EARLY!!!! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay...”
Reviews.Author: watermelon3
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, and the pool looks nice There was plenty of free parking. If you have a car, then it's not that hard to get around. The free breakfast (which had make-your-own waffles) was adequate. The free wireless Internet was fast. However, the air conditioner was rather loud and I had trouble sleeping with the sound. I guess loud conditioner is better than no air conditioner? The door to the bathroom didn't close properly, and the shower was also hard to operate (the knob kept getting stuck). All in all, it was a decent place to stay, but it's by no means luxurious. Maybe I expected too much based on the other reviews I read. It just felt like a clean motel room. Compared to the other places in Key West, this place is a good value though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CECI_11038
Reviews.Content: We only stayed there for 3 days but the room was very comfortable, spacious and clean. The swimming pool and its sorroundings were also great. We really liked it and enjoyed our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and a great value”
Reviews.Author: KWScooterGirl
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Key West, and this was, by far, the best place we've stayed. We had eight nights for just under $1100 - that's a good value in Key West! Our king bed room was extremely clean, and the air conditioning was FANTASTIC! Our housekeeper, Leanora, thoroughly cleaned our room each day, and patiently waited for us when we wanted to sleep in. Many hotels don't clean your room when you're there for an extended stay - they just make the bed and get you clean towels- but Leanora kept our room very clean. The room had a fridge (a must for saving money in Key West) and a microwave and is soundproofed for not hearing your neighbors. The room was very spacious (not like many of the B&Bs in town) and had a beautiful sunrise view of the water. You are literally just steps from the Atlantic and the beautiful paved boardwalk. The pool was huge by Key West accomodation standards, and there were plenty of chairs to go around. The grounds were very well manicured, and there was even a little bridge through a mangrove area where you could get an insider's view of how these Key trees grow. Some of the reviewers foud the airport to be a problem, but not us. The planes were infrequent, and most of them are smaller, less noisy crafts. There was ample free parking (another Key West anomaly). The front desk personnel / concierge service were cheerful and helpful. The only negative for some travelers is that you cannot walk to town from here, and driving and parking in downtown Key West is next to impossible. We are avid "scooterers", so we just rented a scooter for the week, and rode into town. A scooter is definitely THE way to get around Key West anyway (just watch where you park). There is a tour bus that has regular stops right in front of the hotel, so you can hitch a ride that way also. The breakfast is a little better than the inns we've stayed in, since they have boiled eggs and make your own waffles, but is still a challenge for the carb conscious or the diabetic. All around this was a much better option for us than the downtown inns. We're looking forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “My granddaughter didn't want to leave it!”
Reviews.Author: camelette
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and to this Best Western location and other than two small hiccups, we loved the place. We were forewarned to not expect to find restaurants nearby and in fact, the Bennehanna is only steps away, but other than that, you must order take out after 5:30-pm. If you do I HIGHLY recommend the Rum Barrel (excellent food-fast delivery-nice delivery person). Being visually impaired the stairs were somewhat daunting to me. My bad for not asking if they have an elevator-they don't! The breakfast room is open until 10 AM daily and offers a very nice selection of breakfast fare. Hint: There is a footpath bridge over some water through the trees to the third building where the breakfast room is located. We found that on our second day so travel got easier. The nightly hugh chocolate chip cookies in the lobby area MUST HAVE situation for children and adults alike. Hot and Yummy! Too bad there is no on-site restaurant to complete this complex. Nice that the Old Town Trolley and Bus Service is right at your doorstep. 99% of the staff were pleasant and nice to us. Thanks for the great visit-we will be back~

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a group”
Reviews.Author: MN_TWINS!
Reviews.Content: I organized a group to stay at the Key Ambassador June 4-6. The entire group process was simple. Donna took care of my group and made the payment process easy. Our check in took only a few minutes thanks to the hotel staff already having our rooms and room keys ready to go. The pool area is beautiful. Breakfast is adequate and the staff working the breakfast room were fantastic. The room was huge and the beds are new. There is a screened porch area in the back of the room that is nice as well. My room did not have much of a view but if you want a private place to sit you have it. Our rooms had newer furnishings and new flat panel TVs. As stated in other reviews, you are about a 15 minute walk to Smathers Beach and about a 15 minute drive to Duval Street/Mallory Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: meslinger
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Beautiful views, and a nice complimentary breakfast. On roosevelt so it is easy to get around and far enough away from downtown so its quiet at night. Pool is oddly salty but a great little tikki bar also with friendly staff. and it is less than a mile to the beach. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great resort and we will use them again for our next stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: JamminJimE
Reviews.Content: We (my Wife, 3 year old son, and myself) stayed here on a long weekend for our first trip to Key West. This hotel is on the northeast side of the Key. The rooms were great (remember, it's a hotel, just like all of the others) and the one we were in had an amazing view of the water. We were a little far from everything, but there's a bus that stops at the front of the hotel every 15 minutes and takes you right downtown! The ONLY drawback that I found was that we were at the end of the runway for the airport. The flights stopped in the early evening and, if you're there to party, you WON'T care! The front desk person was extremely friendly and helpful when we started with the questions. We booked this trip online and not through the hotel, so our points didn't get credited to our Best Western rewards card (a little bummed about missing out on over 9,000 points!). There was always plenty of parking for free (BIG DEAL in the keys!) so we didn't drive around much. We took one of the public forms of transportation.. Great stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: gator37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel June 1st 2011 to June 5th 2011. First of all this is not a resort. It is an older Hotel that is maintained very well. The rooms were clean and well kept. The outside was landscaped and well kept. That is pretty much all of the positive stuff. The downside includes a salt water pool which leaves you feeling sticky after swimming. The pool is closed at dark (7:00 to 8:00) and the gates surrounding the pool are locked. If you are on vacation (which we were) and you wanted to sit around the pool and visit with friends you are out of luck. You are forced into your room after dark. I thought this was completely ludicrous. You cannot sit on your balcony either with youâ€™re A/C running. The A/C backs up to your Balcony forcing the hot air to where you are sitting. You also cannot bring â€œAnyâ€� beverages to the pool area. You must purchase all beverages from their Tiki hut. Mixed drinks can run you $8.00 and beer is $4.00 each. The service at the Tiki hut varied on who was running it. One day there was an older lady running it and she played music from the big band era. That in itself was rude and made you want to shoot yourself. Eating breakfast was a treat. They serve it in a room that is located on the opposite side of the property. It was about a 1/2 of a block from where our room was to the other side of the hotel. The room had a vanity with one sink. For some reason they installed the miniature refrigerator on a pedestal under the sink right in the middle which was fun stubbing your toes on. They could have easily put it down a little in the space away from the sink. I saved the best for last. You can forget sleeping late anytime. At 7:00 -8:00 a.m. every morning you are awakened to jets taking off from the air port next door. It sounds like they are coming through your room and we stayed on the bottom floor. I would recommend this hotel for business travelers, but not if you want to take vacation in Key West. There are a lot more hotels closer to town that are priced the same that donâ€™t close the pool and lock it down at dark. I would not stay here again. .

Reviews.Title: “Made my 40th b-day great!”
Reviews.Author: SgtPetty
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not the swankiest but for the money it is a great choice. The pool closes early but that's becuase the night life a couple miles away is heating up. Chekie bar at the pool has some great food the wings and mahi Mahi sandwhich were the best to me, it tops some of the more exspensive restaurants. Everything I needed was there. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our trip”
Reviews.Author: Darkeyes61
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Key West we wanted something away from the center of town, this was perfect. We hopped on our scooters and within minutes we were on Duval Street. When we were tired and wanted some quiet we came back to the hotel. Our room faced the pool, had a screened in balcony and could also see part of the ocean as well. Was quiet except for the occasional aircraft coming in or taking off which didn't bother us at all. Staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for a low-key trip”
Reviews.Author: sha987
Reviews.Content: I have plenty of experience traveling around the world, beach areas and otherwise, with my wife. Depending on the circumstances, we like luxury type places and, in other instances, budget places ... just depends. That said, my wife was gone on a separate trip with girlfriends this time around while I stayed at the Best Western Ambassador during a Keys fishing trip with a guy friend. So our expectations and needs were low, given the fact that the purpose of our reservation was mostly just to have a clean, somewhat quiet and convenient place to sleep for a handful of hours when we weren't fishing or touring the bars at night. This Best Western suited our needs just fine. True enough there was the occasional plane flying over during the day, but the nights were quiet, as this place is away from all the hub-hub ... downside of this location is that to hit the bars while still being safe and responsible (while without a designated driver, obviously), one needs to take a cab to and from Duval Street. Ran us usually between $17 and $20 each way for two (was maybe a dollar or two extra for the second person). On the whole, though, this was a nice enough place. Pool area appears well kept and while we were there it was frequented by both families and a small college crowd. Service was fine. Amenities were fine though upon first glance this looks more like a two-story motel than any kind of resort (I'd say it's surprisingly nicer than that on the whole, though). It's right across from the ocean and so while there's a good chance you won't be able to see the water from your room if you haven't paid top price for it, it's at least just a very short walk away if you're curious. All in all, if you're just looking for a relatively reasonably priced place to stay that's away from some of the noise and crowds, this may suit you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay only if you DONT want beach access or a balcony.”
Reviews.Author: Jalinda92
Reviews.Content: I called the Best Western before booking our trip, I was told we only had to walk acoss the street.( 3/4 of a mile away} Our rooms were non smoking like everyone else, no problem most places have a balcony or at least ashcans,here their ashcans are in front of the hotel,?????.Our service was average, we only found out about activeties after being there 1 day already and that was from a very nice young man who was at the front desk. I would recommend this place for over night or someone who likes airplanes flying over your head, or if you have no desire to walk on the beach!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: andy.karla
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay in a large corner ocean view room which was nicely decorated, comfortable and not typical of the usual Best Western middle of the road hotels we have stayed in years ago. The furnishings were new, the room bright, the TV was an updated wide screen, and the amenities of a fridge and microwave as well as a table / desk were great. Connie at the front desk who checked us in and out was fantastic. Always helpful and pleasant she is an asset to the resort. In fact all the staff we had contact with were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was served up in a small room and as previously noted could get very busy at peak times. The assortment of fruit, waffles, French toast etc. was very continental but served the purpose of a complimentary breakfast nicely. All in all this was a great stay that suited our needs. We would definitely consider staying here again should be find ourselves back in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Linemon
Reviews.Content: First thing you notice upon arrival, besides the nice view of the ocean right across the street is the plane noise. How come more of the other reviews didn't note this? Even being a pilot, I wished they could have arrived to the west instead of taking off to the east to decrease the noise. Transportation options are there (local bus, Old Town trolley tours which is a great tour) but the car is the best bet to get you where you want to go. Rooms are fair, of the older style (but newer tv) decoration with a screened in porch thru the sliding glass door, in our case overlooking the pool. Free wi-fi is available along with two free computers in the front desk area, but no safe in room is a disappointment for a vacation destination where cameras and cash are brought. Large size bathroom with toilet and shower separate from the sink area allowing all to get ready with interrupting others. Plenty of parking available, even after returning late. Pool is nice and inviting. Tiki-bar is a nice touch for a lite lunch and drinks, but unfortunately not open long enough (nor is the pool). Free breakfast is nice, but is limited on selections (Hampton Inn offers more). But like others said, is expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: TXLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: When the Comfort Inn's "non-smoking room" we reserved had been smoked in (not acceptable to me because of allergies) - we changed hotels and stayed one night at the Best Western Hibiscus and the next night at the Key Ambassador (because of non-availability the 2nd night at the Hibiscus). I think that the Key Ambassador is overpriced (and we actually preferred the less expensive Hibiscus.) Our ocean-view room at the Ambassador was clean enough and comfortable enough though, and came with a microwave, frig, and had a sliding glass door and outdoor seating area. There is a good bike/walking area across the street that runs alongside the water - you just have to cross a very busy road to get to it. Overall for us, the price didn't fit - even for Key West. If I visit Key West again for any reason, I would first try to find a room at the Hibiscus. If money is not a factor for you, then the Key Ambassador is a good choice as well. Best of all - both Best Westerns are 100% non-smoking!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LAM1168
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have to be the worst hotel at Key West, it is dirty and definitely not what was expected. We arrived went in to check in and walked right out. We then had to cancel those reservations and find another place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: daviaue
Reviews.Content: My vacation were perfect until I head out to this hotel. Personal are not friendly, they don't care about their guests. When I arrived, I asked where I could rent a bicycle and they told me they could take care of that for me. Nice I first thought. But the guy who bring the bike was not really cool, and the bike was so old, no brakes, no light for riding during the evening (where all other rental bikes had lights, so be warn). The hotel is right next to the hotel so you don't need a wake up call.... The pool and bar are closed at 7 PM where the Hyatt next to this one is open until really late. You don't even have access to the pool area to relax once closed. Otherwise, hotel is clean, rooms are big.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for price”
Reviews.Author: hallofamer
Reviews.Content: We just got done staying at the Best Western Key Ambassador. They had great hostipality at the tiki bar (food was good), the front desk helped tremendously, rooms were large and clean. The pool was beautiful and warm and the facilities that are around the pool were beautifully done. The free breakfast in the morning is a little off the beaten path but provided great service which included someone making waffles for you to somewhat of a large selection of foods. Very close to the airport, which you did hear airplanes going by at times during the day. Get a room on the lower floor - you won't hear them as much. The air conditioner had a rattle in it but it didn't bother us to much. It is away from Duval street so we rented a moped (sorry spelling), which in my opinion is the only I would travel for one or two people. Duval street has very limited parking but if you travell by moped you can park anywher and for three days it only cost us $4 for gas - worked out deal with guy and got 3 days for $140 (cash), it was at hotel in less than 10 minutes. Got room for $180 a night - little expensive but then again I am not used to going to hotels outside of the midwest. Great for families!

Reviews.Title: “8 nights in paradise”
Reviews.Author: uspro1
Reviews.Content: After taking my 77 year old father on a 7 day cruise I rented a car in fort lauderdale and we drove down to key west. I have visited the keys several times over the years and wanted to stay in key west this time. I booked the best western because of the reviews and price and was not disappointed. It was everything they advertised and then some. Some of the reviews I had read complained about the airplanes flying over. If you don't like planes this may be an issue. I observed approx. 20 - 25 planes a day and 80% small to mid size prop planes. I did nt hear any planes after 8 OR 9PM. The only other issue I could see was the location to town, but I did see the trolley stop in front of the office about every 30 min.. We stood at the pool and waived on the live web cam to everyone back home in the snow. The complex was very clean and very well maintained. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed near the pool and had a screened in porch. I've taken the time to do a review on any hotel before this one, so that should say it all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tjja
Reviews.Content: We stood at this hotel for 7 nights 8 day, and can't wait to go back. The hotel was beautiful and the view was AMAZING! The staff was more than helpful and very pleasant at all times. When we asked for a late check out there was not even a question asked the answer was yes! This hotel is perfect for a couple looking for an escape or a family that does not want to share their stay with many teenagers there on spring break! Overall I would have to say that we had such a pleasant trip that we are already booking to go back next year. Thank you to the staff for making our trip so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent very happy - good value - nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: spetro85
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Very clean, large rooms, beds were great! Lovely pool area with a Tiki Bar..Got to have a Tiki Bar :) Breakfast was included - it was basic but the food was hot and the coffee good. The location was not a problem for us, everyone rides around town down there on a bike, scotter or some electric vehicle anyways. It is right next to the airport, but KeyWest's airport is on the small side, so its not like they have huge jumbo jets flying out of there. Wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great breakfast, room has all amenities”
Reviews.Author: Texan2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night during our trip to Florida and this was perfect for what we were looking for. The hotel is very clean, has a nice tiki bar overlooking the pool, where we had our lunch. We had booked a "Harbor view" room and it had a decent view. The room was quite large and it had all the amenities one would want - fridge, microwave oven, tea/coffee maker etc. We loved the room and the hotel overall. The parking is free and in front of the room. The location is a bit far away from Duval Street, but if you want to have a nice quite time, this is a great getaway. The breakfast was wonderful. There was a huge selection including french toast, Belgian waffles and boiled eggs. Overall, this hotel exceeded my expectations and I would recommend this to anyone looking to visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: E001066
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 4 days at the Best Western Key Ambassador resort. Have not been to Key West in about 20 years, so I wasn't sure if this was the best hotel. Turns out it was !! Location is on the best side of the island, not too congested and a beautiful view of the Atlantic. The service was wonderful, room was very clean and fresh decor and the pool was simply wonderful. I've stayed and worked at many Florida hotels, and I can honestly say this was the best yet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BDRider
Reviews.Content: The staff were very personable and helpful. The room was very clean and contained lots of extras such as microwave, frig, coffee maker with coffee, and paper plates with flatware. Breakfast was good. The pool is exceptional as is the view of the sunrise from across the street. There is the occassional noise from aircraft flying directly over the hotel from Key West International but it wasn't a show-stopper for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but you need a car”
Reviews.Author: defMunichCanyonRider
Reviews.Content: Located in the neighborhood of the airport, you should expect some airplane noise during the daya. From 6 PM it got quiet. The best is, that you -if you are lucky to have the right room - will have a great view to the ocean from the room. So I could sleep with an open window and hear the waves, nice ! The stuff was very friendly. I had a coupon. And normally with a coupon you get a room, which is not the high standard. But they have been so nice to give me this great room with the ocean view. So thanks again, next time I will stay with you again. The only thing which is not soo good is, that itÂ´s a little bit away from the touristic center. So if you want to go to the town center, you need a car (and a place to park, which can be challenging). But the rest was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Far from center of action. Tranquil and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Mirimica
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and comfortable, a great January vacation

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: lovethesunCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Was nervous about a Best Western as they are not always "the best". However, this place was gorgeous on seven acres of tropically landscaped grounds with a beautiful pool. Rooms were large and very clean and updated. Food at the tiki hut was good with generous portions. Free breakfasts were also great. We were upgraded to a pool and oceanview room and given an additional discount with a coupon from one of the local travel magazines....that was a bonus. Laundry facilities were a plus. You must have a car to stay here as it is far from Duval and all the action, but it is close to Smather's beach. It was actually nice to get away from the craziness of downtown and I would highly recommend this for families with children. Another reviewer complained about parking be we had no problems parking and the hotel was sold out. It is close to the aiport so you do hear the planes but they really weren't that bad...not jumbo jets or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the dollar”
Reviews.Author: okeorb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel during the Fantasy Fest celebration for 4th time. They have been nice to us in the office and the rates are reasonable for that time of year. The pool is great. The rooms and breakfast are very nice. It has always been quiet for sleeping and plenty of parking. I would recommend this place to anyone and looking forward to going back this next Oct.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: BlueMalibu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Key Ambassador for two nights during the last week of December 2010. I was surprised and a little concerned, upon arrival, to find that all the rooms had outside entrances, and my room was at ground level. However, I found my room to be quite large, clean, and modern, with plenty of towels, a fridge, microwave, and even a pull-out couch. The bed was very comfortable, and despite the airport being literally next door to the property, there was no flight activity past 9:30pm and none in the morning to wake you up. During the evening hours, I noticed staff riding around the property in golf carts to keep an eye on what was going on, so that was reassuring, as I was kind of nervous about staying in a hotel with an outside entrance. It made me feel very safe. I arrived for the continental breakfast about an hour before it ended, and found it very crowded, as it is in a very small room with barely any seating. so I left without getting anything. The Key Ambassador is located pretty far from Duvall St, but there is a trolley (I believe it is $30/person) that stops for pickups and drop offs in front of the hotel until 5:30pm, and takes you to Duvall St, Mallory Square, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel, if you don't mind its location being a bit far from all the activity of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous - love it”
Reviews.Author: sunny72664
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at Best Western Key Ambassador Resort Inn. We love the mini suite Harbor View room, it is very clean,roomy and well stocked with towels, bath items and a fridge. The grounds are beautifully kept and a AWESOME pool with a great Tiki bar. There is also a laundry facility. If you get up early enough you can walk across the street and catch a beautiful sunrise upon the Atlantic Ocean. All the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovespain
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel room was clean and quite large. The view from our window was very nice - overlooking the water. The Tiki Bar was nice and the pool was nice. Unfortunately, the only problem is the location. It is much too far from Duval Street. But, if you do not care about Duval Street (which we love), this is the place to stay! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FiftiesHavingFun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Key ambassador for two nights. The hotel staff was wonderful and the room was very clean, stocked with lots of bath products, extra towels and mints. The grounds were very well landscaped. Outstanding pool area and Tiki Bar. The hotel is located close to the airport so there is some noise during the day. All smaller planes. The last plane left around 9:30 and we had an excellent nights sleep. Very easy to get to the night life of Key West by car. Parking in Key West was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: AndyKay42
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to this hotel since 1970. The owners take great pride in it and have remodeled and added many extras over the years. It is presently in need of a little updating in some areas (carpeting, seals around entry doors), but overall it is such an incredible setting. It is a very tropical setting, the Atlantic ocean is right across the street and many of the rooms overlook it as well as the beautiful pool and grounds. An on-premise Cheekie Hut serves great food and tropical drinks. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Our only negative would be noise from the Key West airport and traffic on Roosevelt Blvd. However, Key West is such a small city and island that one would experience these minor annoyances most anywhere they stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you are visiting Key West by car and dont mind airplanes”
Reviews.Author: gdraque
Reviews.Content: It is located right next to the airport at the beginning of the key. With car this means you are 10-15 minutes away from the historical district. We stayed a week and drove there, so the price made the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: friendly_advisor
Reviews.Content: very clean, very roomy, well thought-out room design, furnishings in very good condition, comfortable beds, large bath area, screened lanai (patio) allows outdoor smoking, wireless internet - pc available in lobby (free), nice outdoor pool area (closes around dark) with entry/exit shower and bar, good cable TV selection (not all, but most). nice, clean property grounds. continental breakfast offers fruits, juice, milk, cereal, pastries, some hot items and more, a notch above many others. close to airport (light, smaller plane traffic; none at night). foyer light switch controls desk lamp outlet (a common electrical design), making outlet unusable without foyer light; a very mild annoyance for me. staff was very courteous, friendly, attentive (noticing my cane, offering handicapped room [declined, unneeded] at check-in, which was quick and problem-free, as was checkout), and helpful; excellent choice for most travelers. stayed here 4 or 5 times, never disappointed. five-star? no, but neither is the price (it's an island!); very highly recommended... very!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: GerardPost
Reviews.Content: Typical simple US motel. Would have cost only half outside the Keys. Hence, the overall comfort did not justify the price. Is a bit away from centre of town, so having a car is essential. Is, however, conveniently located near the airport. Noise of aircrafts not a problem as only few daily flights landing/leaving. Free internet and coffee a positive. Breakfast rather modest and served on polystyrene plates with plastic cups and cutlery. At these prices the hotel could do more for the environment and serve on normal plates, in glasses and with metal cutlery. We recommend the motel nevertheless as prices elsewhere in Key West are probably as high and everyone else in the US below 4 stars seems to serve on disposable plates.

Reviews.Title: “What a magnificent tropical paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Roffylee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything I imagined from seeing photos on Hotel.com. The place was like a paradise and the grounds were so gorgeous! The first impression started with the front desk and what a friendly crew. The general manager, Armida, was so sweet and helpful to take the time to show me the room before I even checked in. The gentleman in the morning was also very helpful. The view from my balcony was exactly the view we had on their postcard. The tiki-bar was awesome around the pool and the breakfast each morning wonderful! Not every hotel includes breakfast with your stay. If I ever get the chance to go back, my stay will be here! What a vacation and thank you staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location & great value!”
Reviews.Author: DaveyBoysTravels
Reviews.Content: We only had 1 night in Key West due to our itinerary and we chose to stay here, we were not disappointed! We arrived 2 hours earlier than the advertised check in time, which was no problem for the staff. We were checked straight in & given a larger room than we had booked at no extra cost. The room was very large & overlooked the pool area. I was initially hesitant about this as I was worried about noise from the pool area, but I needn't have been, we didn't hear any noise from the pool area, despite the number of people there. Although we had a car we decided to walk along the path into the centre. At a leisurely pace following the coast it took us nearly an hour, but this was walking v slowly & stopping to take pictures! After checking out from hotel the staff were still brilliant. They allowed us to leave our car onsite while we did some touristy stuff then said we could still use the hotel facilities for the rest of the day even though we had checked out, this included use of the pool, use of pool towels & use of the snack bar. We had a fantastic stay here with no noise from the nearby airport. Absolutely a great place to stay with very friendly staff who cannot do enough for you! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back next year!”
Reviews.Author: GlenbeulahGal
Reviews.Content: We came to Key West for a quick weekend get away with our two kids. Since it is off season here in Florida, we decided to take a chance and not make hotel reservations until we got there. Sometimes it's nice to actually see the hotel and it's location before you commit. We were driving by this hotel and decided to see if they had availability. They did! They also had a nice pool, free continental breakfast and a great location. We agreed to stay and the wonderful desk clerk gave us an upgrade to an ocean view room! I was already thrilled with the price I was paying without the view, now I was over the moon! The kids were so excited when they saw the view. We were right across the street from the ocean and within walking distance of the beach. The airport was also within walking distance but I never heard any plane noise at night. The continental breakfast was staffed with a nice gentleman who was very attentive and friendly. The standard fare I suppose for continental breakfast and we always seem to leave content and happy. Variety of juices and milk, various bakery items, make your own waffles, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee, boiled eggs and the ability to sit and a nice porch and enjoy the fresh air. We also were able to enjoy the pool for a swim. To add to the kids (and ours) enjoyment I purchased some non-alcoholic strawberry daiquiries from the pool bar and a rum runner for dad and I to share. Just lovely! We had called down to the front desk to ask their advice on where to go for dinner. They were very helpful and had a few options for us to choose from. Overall, it was a great place to stay and an amazing value! In fact, because it was such a positive experience, we are already planning our trip here next October and will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: StinkyandStinkpretty
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the BW KW. We have heard all about the complaint about the the noise from planes but they aren't that bad and for us a not a deterent. We sleep late getting up anywhere from 8 to 9am ish. By this time a few planes have gone overhead but we just fall back to sleep - maybe because we stay up later in KW, snokeling all day at Fort Zachary and cruising Duval by night. The hotel is on the east side of the island and a short 15 minute drive from the action of Duval street and all the crazies. It boasts the best pool in KW. We can't comment on this as we prefer the beach at Fort Zackary. The BW has a great continental breakfast. This stay a couple of racoons frequently begged for scraps on the breakfast deck. Please do not feed these animals. The check in and out is a breeze with super efficient and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, but far from the hub”
Reviews.Author: Gatorzman
Reviews.Content: I recommend this resort to those looking for a bargain in Key West. I had trouble finding a reasonably priced single room with two queen beds and this hotel fit the bill. They offer a great service of picking you up at the airport. We then had the scooter rental place pick us up at the hotel to get our scooters. This transportation plan worked fairly well. The continental breakfast was nicely setup with indoor and outdoor seating. They had waffle makers, french toast, muffins, cereal, bread, English muffins, hard boiled eggs and more. They kept the place fairly clean for the huge number of people that were using the space. We went at around 9:30 each morning and the place was very crowded. Might recommend going earlier since they close this up at 10 AM and there would be less people. Another thing that was upsetting was that a little kid had parents that let him feed several raccoons that had showed up outside for handouts. The coons got in a fight over the food and caused a big disruption. No one said anything and I guess the parents weren't up to speed that you don't feed wild animals where people are trying to eat (especially when the coons didn't pay to stay there!). Check-in and check-out went very smoothly. The hotel let us check in early...a nice feature. We did use the pool, which has two waterfalls and is fairly large. A nice cool down after a hot day. However, almost none of the pool rules were being followed and there were a number of foreigners that decided to take over a huge section by tossing around a soccer ball. They weren't very accurate and the ball kept splashing people in the pool that were trying to relax. Kids were diving off the waterfalls, splashing everyone around them, even though there were signs that indicated no jumping or diving from it. I guess if you go to a bargain resort you are going to end up with people that have little courtesy or maybe they couldn't read the signs. Another issue was that there were almost no chairs left. Now for the room. Had a nice size screened-in balcony with chairs overlooking the pool. The TV in the room is horrible..maybe 19 inches and basically had no clear channels and poor reception. The beds weren't fancy, but we were so tired from the days events that we really didn't care. The bathroom had two annoyances...the first was the tub didn't drain (how do the cleaning people not notice this?) and the second was the toilet kept getting stuck open until you jiggled the handle. The hotel is across the street from the ocean...however, there is no beach; only a nice concrete walkway that can be used for taking walks (although it is alongside the road) or jogging. I would only recommend this resort to people looking for a bargain and that don't mind staying far away from the main entertainment area of Key West. We might return if we just needed a place to crash at night.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: ThumperXXX
Reviews.Content: Desk staff awesome. Bar staff awesome. Housekeeping verygood. Maintenance staff could not change a light bulb. Pool & deck dirty, A/C did not work, bed and furniture not comfortable, overpriced for service's recieved. I can not tell a friend to stay here. Better off staying at DAY'S INN for $ 99.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Accomadating Staff, Clean Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Zone10_Gardener
Reviews.Content: Upon early arrival the friendly desk staff immediately upgraded our room to ocean view and allowed us immediate entry Large,clean, spacious, rooms. Although not close to the historic district very close to a walking and biking sidewalk next to the ocean First floor airline flight noise was minimal, but window unit air conditioners were loud and running continuously during the summer heat.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: mice5430
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. The rooms a very large that the two queen size beds actually look small in the room. It was really cleaned and kept in in good shape. The breakfast area was clean and was very good. Other people complain about the airplanes that fly over the hotel from the airport, but we never heard them during the night. they are mostly small prop plane and corporate jets, The hotel is on the other end of the island from duval street and the other attractions but the price and queitness make it worth the 10 to 15 minute drive to them.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with a Nice Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBliss
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in Key West. After seeing some of the other options and the horrible traffic & parking conditions in town, I was glad that we booked a hotel further out. The only bad thing is that it is not walking distance to town, so one must have a car. One could walk across the street and down a few blocks to get to the beach. The pool area is comfortable and has a tiki bar. Their are coin operated machines for laundry and soap is sold at the front desk. We got a 2nd story room with 2 queen beds. The rooms were large and sparse of furniture. We arrived about 3 hours prior to check in, and they let us check in right away. The rooms were clean, but did need a bit of repair. We had to call maintenance out in that we could not get the lamps by the beds to work. The greatest annoyance was the proximity to the airport. The planes passed overhead about 4-6x a night.

Reviews.Title: “beatiful pool, great value no frills hotel on water”
Reviews.Author: wgafster09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property with family on a short overnight weekend trip to Key West. The rooms are very simple but comfortable. The only think i did not like was that the air conditioner was very strong and right next to the bed. The location is secluded and on the water next to the airport. the pool was stunning w/ a nice breakfast served outdoors. the hotel was inexpensive and a great no frills place to stay overall in Key West if you want to stay outside the town.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot”
Reviews.Author: bardenl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights during Spring Break when the hotel was full. The desk staff were welcoming and answered several questions during our stay. The lobby has free USA Today, and in the afternoon they bake a basket of cookies (loved the warm chocolate chip!). There is also a bookcase for leaving and taking books, with a nicely varied selection. I took and turned in 3. As many have said, the pool is large and in a very pretty garden setting with flowers and palm trees. There were always plenty of lounges available in shade or sun. Retired couples, families with young kids, and small groups of younger spring breakers all seemed to be having a good time. The breakfast room attendant kept everything in stock when we were there after 9:00 and there were always places to sit inside and on the screened porch. Cereals, juices, coffee, milk, boiled eggs, muffins, oranges, apples, bananas, French toast, fresh waffles, etc. and large plates to put it on. We paid a very reasonable rate in advance through skyauction and had no problems. Our standard non ocean view room on the second floor had 2 queen beds (we need king or queen because husband is 6' 3'). The beds were very plush and comfortable with nice linens. The room was unusually large which actually made the beds look smaller. There were six bath towels and the usual toiletries and everything was clean and in good repair. We had a small refrigerator but no microwave. The wifi worked fine. Parking was convenient, right by our room and we appreciated coming back to the uncrowded environment after time in old town Key West.

Reviews.Title: “small queen size bed large roooms”
Reviews.Author: talk2me33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before Christmas and any rush We booked well inadvance but were given a double bed instead of a queen size, told management but were told that ALL rooms were queen size upon talking to the cleaner we were told different anyway the rooms are quite large and pleasant, breakfast was well catered for and a good selection Never heard a plane at night though we were very close to the airport In general not a bad hotel for a few nights

Reviews.Title: “Clean - great location”
Reviews.Author: jan1203
Reviews.Content: Very clean - across from the water - beach nearby - can walk to town - loved the outside bar which had good food.

Reviews.Title: “Okey. Nice pool.”
Reviews.Author: FlashPackerSandy
Reviews.Content: Nice pool. Pity that they put mosquito things on balcony. Close to water, but a 10 min walk to proper beach. No beach access across the hotel. Free parking and good wifi (free). They sell sunprotection in the reception :) Close to the airport, which was really odd..... plane came on top of our heads! Started at six o'clock in the morning, finished the night before at nine pm.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel-Motel for one night”
Reviews.Author: IL8
Reviews.Content: If I go to Key west again, I'd pick either a modern good quality hotel (expensive) in the town where all the bars are, or a cheap guesthouse. Best western is just too average and it leaves you with a feeling that you'd wish you either paid more for better or less for something really basic. + one of the cheapest real hotels in Key west + nice pool + decent breakfast + practical - too average for the location -it's basically a motel -you need a car -stinky room -full with old fat americans -price compared to quality

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: FrankK3
Reviews.Content: because we had a 3 day party with our bikes on the keys we didn't spent a lot of time in the hotel- but in fact the service was great- real regular coffee taste was compare with European standards - close to the old town and point of interests

Reviews.Title: “A great stay - very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: half-Brit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in November 2009 and had a lovely time. We got one of the full oceanfront rooms with a marvelous 180Âº view of the water. True, the motel is across the road from the water, but this is the *best* view on Key West for the fairly reasonable price of $130.
