Other hotels were at least twice that amount or more for the same type of view. This side of the island is not nearly as busy as the north side, where all the stores are, so traffic noise was not intrusive. The room was quite large and spacious. It looked NICER in person than on the motel's website! It was very light and airy. We had a microwave and fridge, and they even included plastic cutlery and paper plates. Our room had both a table and a desk, so the laptop could sit undisturbed on the desk. There is good, fast free wifi service. The outside private balcony had two chairs and a small table. This motel has a large selection of types of rooms. The full oceanfront are the most expensive, but they have many rooms which are partial oceanfront, or ocean view. They also have rooms with no views, which are probably extremely reasonably priced. This is not a new motel, nor a "5 star" hotel, and there is no elevator. Our room was fresh and spotless and was kept that way throughout our stay. Outside, the maintenence crew was constantly working - cleaning, painting and doing yard work. Everybody was very polite and friendly. The lobby was pleasant and comfortable. The local paper was available as well as all sorts of local information. The desk staff was always patient and helpful to us, as we contacted them numerous times asking questions about local attractions. They even provided a vase for us to borrow when my husband bought me flowers :-) Breakfast is an expanded continental and was quite good. Everything was fresh. The pool was delightful and surrounded by trees, however, it does close very early at night - 8:00 pm. The little "Cheeky Hut" was enjoyable and we had lunch there one day. It was pretty good food at a reasonable price with friendly service. The only thing that was not great was the guest laundry. There are two washers and two dryers for the whole motel. They are outside, near the housekeeping supply and laundry rooms. There is a big noisy compressor right there, so if you're waiting for the dryer to finish, it's kind of unpleasant :-( At the back of the motel, there is a semi-tame raccoon which seemed to be there on the lawn every day. We also saw two iguanas or some kind of huge lizards there. The motel does back up to the airport runway, so there is some plane noise, (as there is throughout Key West) , but the airport isn't very busy. The local island bus stops right outside the lobby door so if you don't want to drive into old town, you don't need to. The bus is quite inexpensive and stops by every half hour, I believe. [ I notice the review below rated this motel "terrible", but I wonder if they stayed here or at the other, older BW in town? There are no "bathroom windows" in the oceanfront rooms here. The rooms have sliding glass doors leading to an upstairs balcony or downstairs patio.] We had a very pleasant stay here and would not hesitate to recommend this motel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Run, run, run away”
Reviews.Author: Roofers
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid in advance for our last night at this place as we were flying out of the airport in the am, and had read all the great reviews on another website. We arrived in KW a day earlier so we decided to stay there for the add'l night. The office stunk like mold but figured the rooms would be better. They gave us the best room they had with full view of the water.Getting into the room it was VERY musty/moldy but we figured it had been closed up for a time so we stopped the A/C and opened the door and bathroom window for cross vent. It was better by night but when we closed everything and turned on the ac as it was 100 degrees out it was TERRIBLE!! We didn't sleep a wink and left at 7am and booked somewhere else gladly paying double for the piece of mind. It's a motel for people that get evicted from their aptmt's too. NEVER AGAIN!! I even called and the manager but still paid for both nights.

Reviews.Title: “So So Nice”
Reviews.Author: snappytd
Reviews.Content: It was in a great location over looking the beech and the sea....the pool was great.....there was an airport at the back but the planes made it very exciting in a funny sort of way. Need to get a taxi into Duval Street but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “good location, away from all the bustle”
Reviews.Author: tireman001
Reviews.Content: Very nice complimentary breakfast. The rooms were clean but the beds were not as comfortable as we would have liked. The bathrooms were very spacious with lots of couter space too. The pool and outside area were GORGEOUS. The cleaning staff were very helpful as well as the check-in staff. The location was beautiful. It is situated so the hotel has a very nice view of the ocean. It is located right next to the airport, and just a few miles from Duval street. The downtown area was just a few miles away, so sound wasn't a problem and neither was accessibility.

Reviews.Title: “Keywest Fun”
Reviews.Author: island123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Ambassador in Key West for a weekend over the summer, and it was a great deal. It was the Cheapest hotel we found in Key West. The room was very spacious. It was a room with two beds (as we had 3 people staying in the room). It was very clean, with a nice little balcony for smoking or sitting, or drying wet bathing suits, lol. Didn't have time to try out the pool, but it looked like other guests were enjoying it. We drove down, so we had a car to go where ever we wanted, but there is a Sanfransisco-style Trolly that stops in front of the hotel to pick-up/drop-off guests who are going to the 'down-town' area. There is a very tiny strip of land with some Palm Trees that they call a beach that is with-in walking distance, lol (it's about a 1 mile walk). It was nice to lounge around at that beach though. There is also some kind of (Pirate??) museum within walking distance. Duval St. & areas around Duval St. are definetly where all the action is. The hotel is in a quiet area, but we enjoyed that. The only problem we had was the Continental Free Breakfast the hotel offered. It was crazy madness! Tons of guests were crammed into a SMALL cafeteria & there was not enough food. What I saw being offered was banannas, fruit juice, little boxes of cereal, and some dry looking toast. The only thing I ended up grabbing was some apple juice :( ,my family went out to eat else where.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Value & Location!”
Reviews.Author: figaromeezer
Reviews.Content: I don't know why some members complained about this location - it was GREAT! It is away from the historic downtown, but Oh My! the view from my King bed room 224, was just paradise - overlooking the tropically landscaped pool & garden and miles of ocean front! My room on the second floor was perfect - super clean, safe & comfortable! There is no elevator so if stairs are a problem, request a first floor room. Both the entry door and balcony sliding doors have safety latches. The balcony which overlooked the gardens, pool & Tiki bar was screened in so you could relax after a day out and not be bothered by any bugs (not that there were any when I stayed) Check in was a breeze, the employees were nice and helpful, breakfast was a short walk to the other building & featured all kinds of cereals,breads, rolls fruit, milk, coffee, teas, & hard bolied eggs. You could sit in or sit on the covered deck. Since the hotel is located on a preserved mangrove area, all kinds of wildlife visited the deck - a mama racoon with her babies came for breakfast very politely - the hostess tossed her some eggs and toast, a couple of green iguanas basked in the sun and went for pieces of bananas, & by the pool a flock of Ibisis hung around wading around the pool (see, they knew a good thing!). Yes, the pool closes at 8 pm, but most people don't get back from downtown until late anyways so the place is very peaceful & quiet during nighttime. The airport is located nearby,but I was so tired from biking around the island, that after my shower, I fell right to sleep. You do hear the Navy pilots flying over in the morning - it's exciting to watch doing manuevers the ocean. There's plenty of free parking (a plus in KW) if you need a bike rental, the front dest is happy to call whichever company you want to either take you to it, or bring you one. Biking into downtown takes about 40 mins, along the scenic ocean wall. Smather's beach is 15 mins by bike. Make sure you catch Dominique and his performing cats @ Mallory Square starting at sunset, and visit the Butterfly House (take plenty of film or batterly life! Also, when you head out of KW (if you are driving), make sure to stop at the National Key Dear Refuge- drive to the end of the road and you will see lots of the endangered Key Deer, but please drive slowly because they do jump out of the woods! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret on Key West”
Reviews.Author: jts3339
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Best Western Key Ambassasdor for years, and although we could stay anywhere on the island, we wouldn't stay anywhere else. The management is delightful and accomodating, the staff is consistent year to year (which says a LOT), Isaac and Judy at the Cheekie Hut remember our names at every visit and make us feel right at home with friendly conversation and big delicious drinks.. The large pool and spacious grounds are pristine, the rooms are clean, cool, and comfortable, and our every need is met upon request. The location offers a beautiful ocean view overlooking the pool and tropically landscaped grounds. It is a peaceful daily escape from the nightlife which is a few short miles away. This place is exactly what Key West is about - tropical charm, comfort, and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisarenee22
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were outstanding. The accomodations were more than what we expected clean and great prices. We are definitely coming back for another stay here. They say you cant please all the people all the time, who ever has complaints about this place shouldnt have been let out of their rubber room in their insitution anyway. awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to spend a few days but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: CCwsrvCC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights while visiting Key West. It was a fine place, but low on frills. The front lobby had a funny smell, and the front desk personnel weren't particularly friendly. The room was large with 2 (firm and comfortable) double beds, but low on furniture (one dresser, the TV hutch, and a small table). The bathroom had a separate area with sink/mirror, which was very nice. The balcony was large and screened in, but overlooked a parking lot. It was a good place to dry wet dive gear at least. The AC worked well and was reasonably quiet, which was important in late June. The pool was nice, if a little shallow, and there was a tiki bar in the pool area. However, the bar stopped serving snacks at 6 (last call 5:30), which was really inconvenient, so we never made it down there. Transportation was also a little difficult. The hotel would really benefit from some kind of shuttle. There is bus service, but the bus was running 15 minutes late when we took it, and the last bus back was at 10:30, so we had to take a cab ($16 plus tip). The cab was fine for one night, but would get expensive on a longer trip. We didn't stay anywhere else on Key West, so I have nothing to compare it to locally. However, I wasn't impressed, and wouldn't pay the $170 rate to stay there again (used bonus points for this trip).

Reviews.Title: “Wow this is nice..”
Reviews.Author: debbilow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great the front desk Lady Kate and the breakfest bar woman were both great too. Very nice pool except it closed at 8pm.. come on people. Its an older property but very well taken care of. Planning next years vacation already to the same spot.

Reviews.Title: “Comes with complimentary millipede parade - go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: nocturnalorange
Reviews.Content: I am astounded at the good reviews of this hotel (based on which I had booked, in spite of bad experiences with other Best Westerns), as it was unfortunately one of the most grotty places I've ever stayed in. We got off to a bad start with Connie at the front desk who didn't smile and made us feel like a nuisance (note, however, that later reception staff was extremely pleasant and helpful). Given the off-peak season we asked for a seaview - upon which we were told we'd have to pay $60 per night extra (needless to say we left it). Don't get a room on the 2nd floor if you have mobility problems or heavy suitcases as there is no lift. The room itself was very big but dark, badly decorated and very badly maintained. The surfaces are clean - the cleaners (who are also very kind) do a pretty good job but there's no scrubbing away the mould, caked dirt and rust. A particular low point was the bathroom: the ceiling actually had large holes in it, through which we were treated to first a dead millipede in the bathtub, and subsequently a series of creepy crawlies on the towels. I tried not to think of what else was up there, ready to drop into my hair. There was a terrible smell of dampness from the bathroom aswell, which did not go away after I sprayed the place with Dettol. Had we been staying in Key West for longer than 2 nights, I certainly would have left. As part of a driving tour of Florida we stayed in everything from 5-star hotels to motels, and I would have gladly replaced the Best Western with any of the roadside motels. Given the Key West prices and our short stay there I wasn't looking for luxury - what bugs me is that they have done just the barest minimum amount of maintenance they could get away with. The 2 star motels I've stayed in show that it is possible to offer a basic, but well-maintained room. I recommend that you pay a bit extra and try one of the other hotels - or hold off booking until you have seen the room yourself. In terms of location, it is away from the town but there is a bus which stops right outside the reception (ask for a time table at check-in as it doesn't come very often). Last service is around 7.30pm so you'll have to get a taxi back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SnCollins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights recently and really enjoyed our stay. Having stayed in both high-end and budget hotels in the past, I would consider this a clean, comfortable, well-maintained budget hotel. The location is just a few minutes into Key West, near the airport (the noise was not bothersome to us- we only heard a few airplanes the entire time). The hotel consists of a u-shaped building that surrounds the pool/tiki-bar where most rooms would have a partial or full ocean view. Our building was a short walk from the pool across a small parking lot. Though this building was quieter and closer to the continental breakfast room, it did not have an ocean view. (Not a complaint- we requested quiet) The breakfast was good for a continental breakfast, though on three mornings we opted to eat out because the restaurants on Key West are so great. The pool was wonderful...not too full or loud with plenty of chairs and a bar. The pool closed at 9PM, which was a little annoying. To be clear, there is NO beach at this hotel. The hotel sits on one of the busier roads in Key West. Directly across the road is a boardwalk wide enough to bike, rollerblade, etc. that drops off immediately to the water. No sand. On the bright side, it is absolutely beautiful and great to walk at night- we felt very safe. If you are looking for a beach, there is a nice one about a mile down the street and several closer to Duval Street. We did not miss having a beach at the hotel, however, we did have a car which made it easy to navigate the island. Duval Street is wonderful. The nightlife, shopping, and restaurants were all great. We had fabulous food the entire time. My top recommendations, along with a ton of others on here are: Blue Heaven, Salsa Loca, and the Rooftop Cafe. The hotel is not within walking distance of Duval Street (for most). You can rent scooters to get around the island. We did not do this, but will next time. They are not only fun, but easy to park, and parking is scarce and/or expensive near Duval (we spent anywhere from $10-$30 a day to park if we did not get there before 5PM when non-paid parking is more readily available). The trolley tour stops outside the hotel every half hour, but does not run late into the evening, and costs $29 per person per day. Taxis are available in a pinch but are also expensive. The only three small negatives I had for this hotel were: -the location (which is okay if you have a car and don't plan on drinking much). I am pregnant, so my husband had a designated driver. Next time I think we would stay closer to Duval and not rent the car in order to be closer to the nightlife and restaurants. -the rooms are a dated with no-frills. I can't really complain about this based on the price we paid, but don't go expecting anything luxurious. (the beds are very comfortable though!) -the beds.....though they were very comfortable (think NOT firm) they were also very small. I have never been to a hotel where 'two doubles' means 'two full beds'. My husband and I usually ended up in separate beds by the end of the night because we like our space and are used to a queen bed. Amusingly, the rooms are absolutely huge and could more than afford two queens. The television was so far from our bed that it had to be turned up extremely loud to hear it 'all the way over there'. Overall, if you are looking for an inexpensive hotel with close access to active area of Key West without the cost, this is a great option. I would recommend it, however, next time I feel that we'll splurge for a closer hotel and save on the rental car and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Key West Newbies”
Reviews.Author: ddad
Reviews.Content: We choose the Best Western Key Ambassador Resort Inn for an overnight stay in Key West on a Thursday night in March after because our first choice (Best Western Hibiscus) was unavailable. This was our first visit to Key West and we were very happy with our hotel selection. The room was huge (seemed large enough for a square dance), very clean and full of amenities such as bottles of water in the fridge, a coffeemaker and toiletries. It had a bath and closet area, king bed, sofa, table/chairs, bureau, and large flat panel TV. There was a wall with windows and sliders out to a long balcony that faced the ocean. It was great to sit on the balcony and watch the sunrise with our morning coffee. The only staff we interacted with were the front desk supervisor (I think her name was Kate), the tiki bar server and the breakfast lady, all of whom were extremely pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was a wonderful expanded continental breakfast that included French toast (heat up yourself in the toaster). The airplanes did not bother us. In fact, we enjoyed watching the fighter planes from the nearby military base practice while we sat at the tiki bar. We didn't use the pool next to the bar but several groups, mostly families with young children, seemed to enjoy it. Right after getting our room, we caught the Olde Town Trolley tour. The trolley stopped right in front of the hotel lobby (stop #8). We purchased e-tickets tickets online before we left home and saved about $3/person. Since we got on in the middle of the route, we switched trolleys in Mallory Square to finish the tour. The 1 Â½ hour tour is a great way to get acquainted with Key West. The drivers are very entertaining and informative. You'll need a car to get around the island when the trolley isn't running, but parking was not a problem. We paid $10 to park in a lot off Duval Street for the evening while we did the usual touristy things â€“ eat dinner and take in the entertainment at Sloppy Joe's, have a drink at Irish Kevin's and walk around Duval Street. Then back to our quiet, comfortable room for a peaceful night's sleep before leaving the Keys. We completely enjoyed our visit to Key West and the Best Western Key Ambassador Resort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: MarylandKyle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in front of the airport and planes and jets fly out all of the time. If you want to relax and sleep this is not the place to go. The hotel is very clean and the staff are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time We Had and Most Relaxing Ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: diety
Reviews.Content: we where nervous about booking our hotel and vacation online because of our bad, really bad experince with priceline, and our $ 1,800.00. I was calling Best western just about every other day, ( the staff was very understanding) but with all that, every thing was as we requsted the only thing I was upset about was not even under Best westerns control. At the pool adult female guest should realize that there are kids running around at the pool and they should keep there tops on not just there. I cant think of anything I didnt like, as far as being near an airport the only time I heard a plane was late in the day, but who spends there whole vacation at a hotel anyway by the end of your day your there to sleep. GREAT JOB BEST WESTERN!!!!!!!!! Oh and yes we did get our money back from priceline even after them threatening us we wouldnt thanks to our bank and mastercard. My advise, stay at the Best Western and away from Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for the money, especially when compared to competitors”
Reviews.Author: db4thrill
Reviews.Content: While it isn't a Four Seasons, and it's a long walk from Duval street, it is a good choice for the $159 rate. Our King bed room was plenty spacious, very clean, had an ocean view (although not specifically requested) and is one I would easily do again. They recommended the Rusty Anchor restaurant for fresh, quality fish, and the recommendation was spot on - the blackened Grouper was amazing! The free wireless at the hotel is plenty fast and I haven't had any trouble with it. Don't stay here if you need to be seen with the Hollywood elite, but if you're looking for a fairly priced clean room with all the usual amenities in Key West then you'll be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: We were planning to see Key West and the beach, and not spend any time at the hotel except to sleep. So for that reason, it was a perfect place to stay. Far more inexpensive than the Sheraton or Hyatt nearby. We drove past those places daily and they looked basically the same. The bed was comfy and the AC worked great - which I imagine would be important in the steamy summer. The electricity on the entire island went out on our last night there (twice) which was irritating. I wish they would have provided flashlights in the rooms - or some way to use the bathroom or shower without having to leave the door wide open in order to get some kind of light in there (there aren't windows in the bathroom). We didn't eat the breakfast, but caught them before they closed ne morning to grab a banana. It looked fine. The pool looked fine, too. All in all it's a "fine" place to stay. Especially for those who want to get out and explore the island, instead of being stuck in the same hotel day after day. Best meal: OPERA italian restaurant - just amazing. Best location: Louie's Backyard

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sky_ash
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel, very peaceful location, friendly staff, complementary breakfast and reasonable price. It is very close to smathers beach. Hotel's location allowed us to take peaceful morning walks along side Atlantic ocean. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It's Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tommy2pdx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from September 28, 2008 thru October 2, 2008 and couldn't have enjoyed ourselves more. The location is on the quiet less touristy side of the island. The property has been cared for and the owner has taken the time and money to keep it attractive, clean and inviting. We got a great rate (120.00 per nite before tax) and found the room to be spacious, clean, well stocked with amenities and blessed with a killer AC unit. The weather was warm (high 80's with 90% humidity). The large and varied breakfast on site was an added plus. The lady who presided over the breakfast room each day was a delight. Get her to tell you her Forrest Gump joke, it's cute. We swam in both the pool and the ocean each day. The public beach is a short distance away and we wathced beautiful sunsets from here. All in all, a great location, clean room and very competitively priced. We have sung it's praises to all who will listen should they be headed down Key West way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great price”
Reviews.Author: SaintThomasBound
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July, got a great! rate thru AAA and then called the hotel direct. They honored the same rate-high season $99. Everything was absolutely perfect for us. For $99 we were situated right across from the ocean on the bottom floor. Saw the sunrise everyday as well as the sunset. Two adults, three large teens and we all had plenty of room. Hotel employees were accomadating each time we talked to them. We are both in the hotel industry, so we expect alot. We certainly got more than we paid for at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: TJMtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2006 and had a very nice experience. They breakfast that they provide is one of the best we have ever had at such a place. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. Our special requests were honored. The pool was nice and we liked the small waterfall it had.

Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: bballstud22262
Reviews.Content: this hotel sucks, the smell is terrible in the room...it sstraight up nasty in here

Reviews.Title: “Good deal of a hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Bookt
Reviews.Content: The Key Ambassador is a very good deal for a hotel in Key West. My family and I spent two nights there in early August. The room was very large with two double beds, large tv, balcony, refrigerator and sink seperate from toilet/shower, a godsend for families. The air conditioning works very well, which you really appreciate after the constant heat in Key West. Breakfast in a dining room area was pretty good for a free breakfast, variety of one serving Kellog's cereals, breads to toast, variety of muffins and a nice variety of juices and coffee. Included several fruits as well as french toast (toast yourself), or hard boiled eggs for protein. For entertainment for us and our kids, the pool was quite large with two little waterfalls. There was a Tiki Hut bar/snack bar, serving food. There is a shuffle board court my daughter and I had fun playing around with. The nicest part was the wide concrete walkway along the bay right across the road from the hotel. We saw a variety of fish and sea birds as we walked along the walkway, the view also included a great sunrise over the water. The hotel is on the "quiet side" of the island, on the other side of Key West from Old town and all the action and tourists. The hotel is only about a ten to 15 minute drive to all the touristy places. Best of all the hotel is pretty quiet, very clean and the staff at the front counter, when not busy answering many questions on the telephone, very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Key West”
Reviews.Author: K T
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very large yet compared to my usual hotel of choice. The place has seen better times and is due for some renovations in some rooms. The pool is said to be the largest ocean front in Key West. Do not expect to be able to walk to the beach from the pool. The road separates the two, which is visible from the hotel beach cams. The hotel has all sorts of views from patio. The more expensive are the beach ones obviously. I chose to stay at the lower end not pay for a beach view. Do expect you may have a view of a parking lot and fence! I still would not pay that much more for the ocean. We got the breeze just fine as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: xgi
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador was what we were looking for in Key West. It has a great view, we had an oceanview room with a balcony. It is easy to get to all downtown attractions but removed from all the things that can be unpleasant in Key West. Extremely clean and quiet. A good place to relax and be able to come back to rest. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2x and no probs”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl815
Reviews.Content: I used my AAA discount and got a good deal on this hotel where i would have paid an insane amount of money anywhere else on the island. The rooms are always clean, the balconies nice and big...pool is nice, plenty of lounge chairs. Tiki bar is a bit pricey but that is to be expected. We asked for extra towels and they were brought to the room within ten minutes. There are buses that run around the island all day and stop at the Front Office to pickup and drop off. The continental breakfast is great. With the amount of money you will spend in Key West, a free continental breakfast is a definate plus! Its nice to sit at the pool and see the beautiful water just across the road. The front staff was very helpful in helping plan activities for us to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel just needs a few extras for guests”
Reviews.Author: suebeeCincinnati
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I would recommended it to anyone. Yes, there are planes fying overhead but, you barely notice this. The rooms were very clean and hotel staff was great. The only problem that I found was the cost of transportation to the other side of the island. They could greatly benefit from a shuttle or even moped or bike rentals at there facility. Most are located on the other side leaving you to find a way there and a way back. Stay clear of the local bus transportation it is definately an experience. It would be nice if ther tiki area stayed open a little later. And tiki staff a little more friendly. Over all I would definately stay again if the transportation issue was fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Big Balcony!”
Reviews.Author: NC5Travelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children.The room was huge and we were all impressed with its size. There was a fridge in the room which was nice. There was also a door leading to a screened balcony which my husband and I enjoyed after the kids went to bed. In the am, there was a really good bfast included. Waffles, fruits, cereal, muffins,coffee and juices included. The pool was very nice and warm too. It has two small waterfalls and there is a pool bar, which we did not use. Across the street from the hotel is the ocean, although there is not a beach right there. We drove a short half mile down the road to visit the beach. We were on the second floor, of two floors. There is not an elevator so this could be an issue for elderly or handicapped people. We did not hear other guests when in our room, which was great. The bathroom door would only close with a slam, the carpet seemed a little dirty although it looked clean since it was dark in color and one of the room keys did not work to open our room. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and wished we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: hammonl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a first floor, ocean front room in Feb 2008. The room was over-sized, extremely comfortable and clean, with a coffee maker, micro-fridge. The furnishings were clean and not worn, and plenty of storage space to put your items away. There was a balcony with very nice seating, where we drank our morning coffee every day overlooking the ocean (across the street). The pool area is beautiful and clean; we ate at the Cheekie Hut by the pool the first night we arrived to avoid having to go out on our first night. Our salads were very good, and the service was fine. The breakfast area is a little small for the crowds they have, but the breakfast was very good. We ate there every morning. We were never disturbed by any noise from the airport. In reading the other reviews, we did not encounter any of those issues. Perhaps the rooms that are not oceanfront arenâ€™t as nice; I really canâ€™t say, but I would not hesitate to recommend the ocean front rooms to anyone. We spent 7 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. It is a first class facility, and the staff was very friendly and nice, providing us information on getting around town and recommendations, etc. on multiple occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: cmsweetheart
Reviews.Content: The view was nice, the pool was lovely, and the service was outstanding. Best continental breakfast I've ever had in a hotel. Large rooms with lots of storage. There was noise from the airport, but you couldn't hear it in the hotel room. Great value for the money, would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Tired”
Reviews.Author: azahunting
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location if you like to sleep on the end of a airport runway....sometimes you have to duck your head or the planes will mess your hair. The rooms are like old Motels. The door had a 2" space at the bottom for creatures to crall in. With a swamp behind the hotel....it makes you wonder. The only nice thing about it was the pool setting. The pool was the warmest I've ever been in. But it was dirty. The walls were brown. They have the sadest breakfast you've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Sound insulation companies, apply here!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelarchitect
Reviews.Content: We could hear everything and everyone. This hotel is located right next to the airport, at the end of the runway, so expect some LOUD PLANES to wake you up around 6-7 in the morning. If you ask me, I am fine with planes, but THIN WALLS and lack of any SOUND INSULATION drove me NUTS. I could hear every fart from every neighboring room: up above, next one to the left, next on to the right. Some people had babies waking up in the middle of the night, loud as they usually are, obviously waking me and my wife up. But it gets better. Couple next door had issues. They screamed and yelled at each other all night long and we were witnesses to it. We could hear every single word. I did not sleep!!! RUINED MY VACATION!!! The only thing that is great is the pool. Nice and big, with bar right next to it. The only downer is that it closes at 8:00pm. So don't plan on these romantic pool-n-bar night time journeys. Family only... (ugh!) The other thing that I was looking forward to was free continental breakfast. In this case, free breakfast is... well, free!!! It was single worses breakfast in my life. I usually stay at Hampton Inn. Their free breakfast is breathtaking. Key Ambassador had the cheapest stuff out there. A dollar for a gallon orange juice... puke-out coffee... shotty rice-crispies(I can get em anywhere, right?!) and crappy "penny a dozen" pastry. NOTHING BUT A MORNING HEARTBURN. Ruined experience once again... All the other things were OK. I mean, usual cleanliness of the rooms, etc. You would expect that for this kind of price. But It would expect much more. Way more...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: livinlargewi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during Fantasy Fest 2007 for four nights. I booked through the hotel website about 8 months in advance to secure a rate that was expensive, but reasonable for Fantasy Fest. On the positive side- we had a pool view room with a large balcony. The pool area was quiet, but definately five star. As for the room- I have to say it was larger than average. Lots of closet space. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. I can't stress that enough. The only negative is that it's close to the airport, and you will hear the constant sound of planes taking off... starting at around 7AM each morning. It didn't bother me too much, but it would annoy a light sleeper. Overall- I had a GREAT stay! I would definately do it again, if the Best Western Key Ambassador has a vacancy. I highly recommend this hotel, if you don't plan on staying right on Duvall Street... where rates are rather pricey.

Reviews.Title: “simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: whodog
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a GREAT 4 day stay in Key West at the Best Western. Road work is completed, the weather was fantastic and the hotel staff were superb! Our room was clean, the bed was comfy :). Easy access to downtown KW via bus, taxi or our own car. Plenty of parking and oh yes - the pool and tiki bar was 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginnyLondon
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Key Ambassador hotel was wonderful, when we first arrived we were disappointed with the initial location and what looked like basic motel rooms from the outside, but were pleasantly surprised with our sea view room. It was the largest hotel room I have ever stayed in, with two large queen beds, plenty of storage, just newly renovated, good quality furniture, a desk for the free high speed wireless internet access for those of you (like us) who may still ahve to work while on holiday with our laptop. The balcony was lovely with very nice furniture as opposed to the usual plastic chairs on balconies and the view was amazing of the Atlantic Ocean. The continental breakfast included was lovely and surprisingly plenty of options, just expected coffee and muffins, but a good selection of cereals, breads, muffins, cakes and fruit was supplied as well as hard boiled eggs. There was also a resident friendly racoon outside on the deck who waited every morning for tit-bits from the children. We chose this hotel because it said "Ocean front" and it certainly was Ocean Front but we thought it meant on the beach, unfortunately what we did not realise was that Key West did not have any real beaches as such, only a couple of man-made ones. The pool was lovely and again the photos on the web site did not do it justice, it was large, with plenty of sunbeds, pool bar with a great selection of food on offer and free pool towels which you got from reception. Although the hotel was a little way from the ation and the centre of town i.e. Duval Street, it was only a 5-10 minute beautiful drive to there so was not a problem. Also there are buses and the local tour guide bus which stop directly outside the hotel for hose of you who do not wish to drive. Duval Street was great to see with it's restaurants and bars and Mallory Square was great fun with it's sunset view and street entertainers. We spent 5 nights on Key West at the Key Ambassador and really enjoyed our stay there, would definately recommend this hotel. Staff were wonderful too, immediately helpful and polite from the recption down to maintenance and cleaners.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jjrugs88
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We asked for a pool view and we were given a room with ocean and pool views. The continental breakfast that was available every morning was pleniful and well serviced. A newspaper was delivered to our room every morning and there was a fridge in this room.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Key Ambassador Resort Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3755 South Roosevelt Boulevard, Key West, FL 33040
